item.title: tcpdump: Learning how to read UDP packets
item.description: Philand I spent some of Friday afternoon configuring statsd: We configured it to listen on its default port 8125 and then used netcat to send UDP packetsto see if it was working like so: echo -n "blah:36|c" | nc -w 1 -u -4 localhost 8125 We used tcpdump to capture any UDP packets on port 8125 like so: tcpdump -i lo udp port 8125 -vv -X To briefly explain the options we passed to it:
